question: What is the commonest aneuploidy seen in neonates born with single umbilical aery?
exp: Single umbilical aery: - It is seen in 5-10/1, 000 bihs & its frequency increases in twin bihs - 30% of these infants are associated with more than one congenital abnormalities; among which Trisomy 18 is most commonest - Though it is associated with increased risk for occult renal anomaly, if no other anomalies are present, need for renal USG is controversial

question: Maximum oxygen saturation is there in which of the following blood vessels in a fetus?
exp: Oxygen saturation of different blood vessels in fetus: Umbilical vein > Ductus venosus > Inferior vena cava > Ascending aoa > Descending Aoa > Umbilical aeries

question: The heart assumes its normal four chambered shape by the end of:-
exp: - The heart assumes its normal four chambered shape by the end of 6 weeks of intrauterine life. - From then, only minor changes occur & consist mainly on growth of the heart as a whole with increasing age of fetus.

question: Umbilical cord has:
exp: CONTENTS OF UMBILICAL CORD: - 2 Umbilical aeries - 1 Umbilical vein - Rudimentary allantois - Remnant of omphalomesenteric / vitellointestinal duct - Whaon's jelly

question: Oxygenated blood is carried to the fetus by?
exp: - Umbilical vein -> carries oxygenated, nutrient rich blood from placenta to fetus - Umbilical aeries -> carries deoxygenated blood from fetus to placenta for oxygenation - Ductus venosus -> shunt that allows oxygenated blood from umbilical veins directly into inferior vena cava - Hypogastric aery -> aka internal iliac aery -> Supplies pelvic viscera
